lexUnit.name: stupid.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: lacking intelligence or common sense.

sentence.text: The 29-year-old complained bitterly about pin positions , said it was stupid that players shooting scores of ` 101 and 98 " should be allowed to compete and claimed a tournament allowing such poor players should not be a Ryder Cup points-counting event .
` I stopped when a police car pulled up because I thought it was stupid to go on running . "
It was stupid of me to try to marry you like that without explaining .
It was stupid to be like this .
It was too stupid of her to let the memories come crowding in so easily .
It 's a bit stupid to have all these doors open you know ?
If you are too stupid to know when to draw the line physically then you will be too stupid to know when to stop emotionally as well .
My client is too stupid to have committed these crimes . "
I was stupid to think that I could bring reason and truth into their lives and thoughts .
I was stupid to kiss you first .
I 'm so stupid that I started doing cocaine to try to understand him -- to get close to him and understand where he was coming from .
Does she think me so stupid that I do n't know they do that ?
There is no particular reason to think that people who are determined to get their hands on vulnerable children will be so stupid that they can not pass examinations .
And the characters are so stupid you can laugh at them . "
And it is very stupid for anyone in any position of power to think that what goes around does not come around . "
We thought it was stupid for him to fly all the way back to the UK and then find that we had a problem with Jones , said Lions ' manager Geoff Cooke .
Asking the way down with the glory of sight restored would have been stupid in the extreme , and I gave secret thanks for my ego salvation .
It was stupid of me , " Backley said .
` It was therefore particularly stupid of you to sneak into the Mission on a Sunday and attempt to go behind my back .
` Pretty stupid of me , I suppose , " he replied , ` but then I always was a sucker for a sob story . "
I AM reluctant to believe that the British people are so stupid as to return anyone but nice Mr Major at tomorrow 's election .
But let 's not be stupid about the freedom we enjoy .
Bernie laid right into me , telling me I was stupid for losing them .
Stephen seemed unperturbed , and she felt stupid for allowing the scene at the airport to upset her so much .
` Do n't be silly , why do something stupid like hurling yourself in front of a train , " the thoughts crowded his mind .
On Harper 's behalf it was said that although he 'd been reckless , dangerous and stupid by starting the fire , there 'd been no evil or mischief in his mind .
Could Filmer have been so stupid as to get the horses ' names wrong in addition to the cities ?
But they would never be so stupid as to allow us to find him .
Charts are a really stupid way to value music .
You must think I 'm a very stupid person !
It 's a stupid habit , not putting the price on .
People could be amazingly stupid .
Really , Honor , you are so stupid . "
The poor were just as stupid as the rich ; he had only contempt for both of them .
Never again would he be so stupid as to embroil himself in something like this .
Everyone who subsequently learned of this action condemned it as utterly stupid and irresponsible , but perhaps such criticism may be tempered by the fact that the man was in a deep state of shock .
